{"metadata":{"objective":"","lastStepAudioPath":"summary","audioPath":"D3/1/Refresher"},"steps":[{"headerText":"","leftText":"<p><span class=\"ju-cktitle\" style=\"color:#025B5B;font-family:lato,sans-serif;font-size:20px;font-weight:bold;\">Three&#39;s a crowd!&nbsp;&nbsp; </span><br /><br />You&#39;ve finished authoring a new mini-lesson and are disappointed that it does not look as easy to read as you had hoped.<br /><br />The amount of spacing you use between sentences and lines can make a big difference.<br /><br />Read on to find out about the JUICE team&#39;s recommendations.<br />&nbsp;</p><p><ju-link linkstep=\"2\">Spacing between sentences</ju-link></p><p><ju-link linkstep=\"2\">Overview: Spacing between lines</ju-link></p><p><ju-link linkstep=\"2\">Try it: Spacing between lines</ju-link><br /><br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p><img alt=\"\" src=\"data:image/png;base64,\" /></p>","settings":{"showHeader":0,"showAudio":1,"audioPath":"","hideRightPanel":0,"showNext":1,"delayStep":"0","delayRight":"0"}},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>Use two character spaces between each sentence. This paragraph has only one character space between each sentence. The difference is subtle, but the text looks a little crowded.&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>One character space between sentences can seem a little crowded.</p>","headerText":"Spacing between sentences"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>This paragraph uses two character spaces between each sentence.&nbsp; The difference is subtle, but it is a little easier to read.&nbsp; Fun fact:&nbsp; Two character spaces between sentences used to be the standard for all typing and word processing!<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>Sentences with two spaces between them are easier to read!</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>In the left panel, use 2 shift+ENTER characters between each line.<br /><br />This is an example of that spacing.</p><p>This line is only 1 ENTER character below the previous line.&nbsp; Notice how it is a little tighter?<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>The right panel is naturally spaced to be 150%.&nbsp; For this panel, use just 1 ENTER character between each line.</p><p>This is an example of that spacing.</p>","headerText":"Overview:  Spacing between and after lines"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>In the left panel, use 1 shift+ENTER character after the last line of text.&nbsp; This will ensure that there is the right amount of spacing below the last line when the Overview is being viewed on a small screen device that causes the right panel to wrap underneath the left panel.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>In the right panel, do not include any ENTER character after the last line.&nbsp;&nbsp; The right panel will naturally include enough spacing after the last line.</p>"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":1,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>The spacing rules for spacing between lines in the left panel of a Try it are the same as they are for the Overview.<br /><br />Use 2 shift+ENTER characters between each line.<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>In the right panel of a Try it, use a single ENTER between multiple choice/ multi-select interactions.<br /><br />Use 2 shift+ENTERs between short answer or fill-in interactions so that the check answer arrows are spaced out enough.</p>","headerText":"Try it: Spacing between lines"},{"settings":{"showAudio":1,"showNext":1,"showHeader":0,"hideRightPanel":0,"delayStep":0,"delayRight":0,"fullWhiteboard":0},"leftText":"<p>The spacing rules for spacing after the last line in the left panel of a Try it is the same as they are for the Overview.<br /><br />Use 1 shift+ENTER character after the last line of text.&nbsp;<br />&nbsp;</p>","rightText":"<p>In the right panel, do NOT include ENTERs after a multiple choice or multi-select interaction.</p><p>DO include a shift+ENTER after a fill-in interaction, or a short answer field.</p>"}],"overviewHeader":"Overview"}
